title: Testing Business Cycle Theories: Evidence from the Great Recession
abstract: arXiv:2403.04104v1 Announce Type: new  Abstract: Empirical business cycle studies using cross-country data usually cannot achieve causal relationships while within-country studies mostly focus on the bust period. We provide the first causal investigation into the boom period of the 1999-2010 U.S. cross-metropolitan business cycle. Using a novel research design, we show that credit expansion in private-label mortgages causes a differentially stronger boom (2000-2006) and bust (2007-2010) cycle in the house-related industries in the high net-export-growth areas. Most importantly, our unique research design enables us to perform the most comprehensive tests on theories (hypotheses) regarding the business cycle. translated_title: 测试商业周期理论：来自大萧条的证据
translated_abstract: 使用跨国数据进行的实证商业周期研究通常无法获得因果关系，而在国内研究中主要集中在低迷时期。我们首次对1999-2010年美国城市间跨行业商业周期的繁荣期进行了因果调查。利用一个新颖的研究设计，我们展示了私人标签抵押贷款的信贷扩张导致了高净出口增长地区房屋相关行业在繁荣期（2000-2006年）和低迷期（2007-2010年）的差异性更强的周期。最重要的是，我们独特的研究设计使我们能够对有关商业周期的理论（假设）进行最全面的测试。我们表明以下理论（假设）无法解释1999-2010年美国商业周期的原因：投机狂喜假说、实际商业周期理论、抵押品驱动的信用周期理论、商业不确定性理论以及外推期望理论
tldr: 该研究通过测试1999-2010年美国跨都市商业周期的繁荣期发现，私人标签抵押贷款的信贷扩张导致高净出口增长地区的房屋相关行业在不同程度上经历了更强烈的繁荣和低迷周期，同时证明多个商业周期理论无法解释这一现象
en_tdlr: This study examines the boom period of the 1999-2010 U.S. cross-metropolitan business cycle and finds that credit expansion in private-label mortgages leads to a differentially stronger boom and bust cycle in the house-related industries in high net-export-growth areas, while showing that multiple business cycle theories cannot explain this phenomenon.
